zone.line: Thrones altars judgment-seats & prisons ; wherein
And besides which, by wretrched men were borne
Sceptres tiaras swords & chains, & tomes
Of reasoned wrong glozed on by ignorance,
Were like those hideous secret& barbaric shapes
The ghosts of a no more remembered fame
Which from their unworn obelisks look forth
In triumph oer the palaces & tombs
Of those who were their conquerors, mouldering round
These imaged to the pride of Kings & priests
A dark yet mighty faith, a power as wide
As is the world it wasted, and are now
But an astonishment ; even so the tools
And emblems of it's last captivity
Amid the dwellings of the peopled Earth ,
Stand, not o'erthrown, but unregarded now;
And those foul shapes, abhorred by God & Man
Which under many a name & many a form
Strange, savage, ghastly, dark & execrable
Were Jupiter, the tyrant of the world
And which the nations panic-stricken served
